title: The Lifetime Healthcare Companies Offers Protection for Affected Individuals Following Cyberattack
text:
The Lifetime Healthcare Companies 
DENVER -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- COPIC was recently informed by The Lifetime Healthcare Companies (LTHC) of a cyberattack on its Information Technology systems. COPIC partners with MedAmerica, an affiliate entity of LTHC, to administer its long-term care coverage. COPIC’s potentially affected certificate holders have been sent a letter notifying them of the attack, which was discovered on Aug. 5, 2015, and initially occurred on Dec. 23, 2013. 
LTHC reports that its investigation into the attack has not determined that any unauthorized data was removed from its systems. LTHC also has no evidence to date that such data has been used inappropriately. 
LTHC has established a dedicated call center (1-877-589-3331) for all impacted individuals. And, the company has established a dedicated website ( www.lifethcfacts.com ), where members and other affected individuals can view frequent questions and answers and sign up for free credit monitoring service and identity theft protection services. 
Also, additional information has been posted on COPIC’s website at www.callcopic.com/LTCcyberattack . View source version on businesswire.com: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20151023005822/en/ Copyright © Business Wire 2015
